item.title: Distributed Computing: Julia vs MPI (Julia is super easy)
item.description: In this tiny post, I show with a minimal example the main difference between the distributed computing approaches of Julia and MPI. For this we will use Stampede 2, the University of Texas’ supercomputer (the faster at any university as of now). This is an Intel Skylake cluster that uses SLURM as it’s job queue system. We will show step-by-step how to run a distributed hello-world program in both languages.
